text.style: text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 21.945px; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 21.945px; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 21.945px; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 18.6533px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(17, 68, 51); stroke: rgb(34, 136, 102);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(17, 68, 51); stroke: rgb(34, 136, 102); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: -- Gets of Fenris gift
Fenrir are Gaia’s ultimate warriors, effortlessly switching from
offense to defense as the needs of battle demand. A
mongoose-spirit teaches this Gift.
-- System
The player reflexively spends one Willpower point. For the next
day, the character need neither make a Willpower roll nor spend a
Willpower point to abort to a defensive action.

text.style: font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 18.6533px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(17, 68, 51); stroke: rgb(34, 136, 102);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(17, 68, 51); stroke: rgb(34, 136, 102); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: -- Philodox gift
Fortifying herself with purpose and will, the werewolf shuts out the
pain of her wounds. A bear- or badger-spirit teaches this Gift.
-- System
The player spends one Willpower point; the character ignores all
wound penalties for the rest of the scene.

text.style: font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 18.6533px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(17, 68, 51); stroke: rgb(34, 136, 102);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(17, 68, 51); stroke: rgb(34, 136, 102); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: -- Homid gift
Though many of Gaia’s children use tools, none have mastered them
so thoroughly as humanity. The homid focuses this mastery into the
tools she uses, causing their spirits to awaken and lend her aid. An
ancestor-spirit or spirit of a man-made object teaches this Gift.
-- System
The werewolf spends a turn concentrating, and then the player rolls
Wits + Crafts (difficulty 7). Each success reduces the difficulty by one
on the next roll she makes for her character to employ a tool made
by human hands. The purpose is irrelevant—this Gift is equally
efficacious for attempts to repair an engine, drive a car or fire a
gun.

text.style: text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(17, 68, 51); stroke: rgb(34, 136, 102); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: start; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

g.text: WaWWoD Cross+Over Sheet WW20-29.09 ©2024, Red Fox Studios.

text.style: text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 7.13213px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

g.text: Red Fox Studios are a subsidiary of Pentex Inc.
